1    | /***************************************************************
2    | $Header: /djgpp/sv2agw/tn_srv.c 1.0 Mon 08-21-2000 3:53:22 pm $
3    | 
4    | Telnet interface for AGWPE/TCP
5    | ****************************************************************/
6    | 
7    | #ifdef TN_SRV
8    | 
9    | /*+ Normal includes  +*/
10   | #include <stdio.h>
11   | #include <stdlib.h>
12   | 
13   | /*+ Includes for network functionality  +*/
14   | #include <netinet/in.h>
15   | #include <sys/socket.h>
16   | #include <netdb.h>
17   | #include <arpa/inet.h>
18   | #include <unistd.h>
19   | #include <stdarg.h>
20   | 
21   | #ifdef DJGPP
22   | #include <lsck/lsck.h>
23   | #else
24   | #define lsck_perror perror
25   | #endif
26   | 
27   | #include <fcntl.h>		/*+ For fnctl() -> non-blocking  +*/
28   | 
29   | 
30   | /*+ Include own header files  +*/
31   | #include "fortify.h"
32   | #include "ringbuf.h"
33   | #include "tn_srv.h"
34   | #include "agwsubs.h"		/*--- For STATUS definitions  */
35   | 
36   | /*+ Local variables +*/
37   | static int telnet_sock;				/*+ Socket number which will be assigned to telnet client +*/
38   | static int listen_sock;
39   | 
40   | /*+ External variables +*/
41   | extern int agwpe_status;
42   | 
43   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
44   | Initialization function for listening on a port (23) for incoming
45   | connection requests.
46   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
47   | int 
48   | telnet_srv_init(char *port)		/*+ Port nr to listen on +*/
49   | {
50   |   struct sockaddr_in in;
51   | 
52   |   memset ( &in, 0, sizeof ( struct sockaddr_in ) );
53   | 
54   |   listen_sock = socket ( AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0 );
55   | 
56   |   in.sin_family = AF_INET;
57   |   in.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
58   |   in.sin_port = htons ( atoi ( port ) );
59   | 
60   |   /*--- The `bind()' function assigns a local socket-address to socket S that */
61   |   /*--- has no local socket-address assigned.  When a socket is created with */
62   |   /* Always check return values! */
63   |   if (bind(listen_sock, (struct sockaddr *) &in, sizeof (struct sockaddr_in)) == -1) {
64   |       lsck_perror("bind");
65   |       exit(1);
66   |   }
67   |   
68   |   /*--- Set the maximum number of connection that can wait to be handled by accept */
69   |   /*--- Always check return values! */
70   |   if (listen (listen_sock, 1) == -1) {
71   |       lsck_perror("listen");
72   |       exit(1);
73   |   }
74   | 
75   |   /*--- Use fcntl to accept calls in a non-blocking way wo we still
76   |         can use CTRL+C or do something else */
77   |   fcntl(listen_sock, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
78   |   printf("\nListening on port %s for incoming connection requests ",port);
79   |   agwpe_status |= TN_LISTENING;
80   |   
81   |   return(0);
82   | 
83   | }
84   | 
85   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
86   | Check if a connection request is made to the socket we listen on
87   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
88   | int 
89   | check_conn_request(void) 	
90   | /*+ Returns TN_DISCONNECTED if no request was made, return TN_CONNECTED if a conncetion was received +*/
91   | {
92   |   size_t len;
93   |   struct sockaddr_in peer_in;
94   | 
95   |   /*--- Check if we are in listening status */
96   |   if (!(agwpe_status & TN_LISTENING)) {
97   |     printf("\n Not listening");
98   | 	return(agwpe_status);
99   |   }
100  | 
101  |   /*--- Listen on port 23  */
102  |   /*--- The `accept()' function returns the first completed connection from the */
103  |   /*--- the pending connection queue form a listening socket. */
104  |   len = sizeof ( struct sockaddr_in );
105  |   telnet_sock = accept ( listen_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&peer_in, &len );
106  | 
107  |   /*--- Do we have a connection or is it actually an error? */
108  |   /*--- If marked non-blocking and no pending connections are present  */
109  |   /*--- it returns -1 and set ERRNO to EWOULDBLOCK. */
110  |   if (telnet_sock == -1) {
111  |     if (errno == EWOULDBLOCK) {
112  |       return(agwpe_status);	/*--- No connection request made */
113  |     } else {
114  |       lsck_perror("check_con_request()");
115  |       return(agwpe_status);
116  |     }
117  |   }
118  | 
119  |   /*--- If we come here, we have an incoming connection  */
120  |   printf ("Connection made from %s:\n", inet_ntoa(peer_in.sin_addr));
121  |   agwpe_status &= ~TN_LISTENING;	/*--- Reset listening flag */
122  |   agwpe_status |= TN_CONNECTED;		/*--- We have a connection now  */
123  |   tn_printf("Welcome to PA3BTL telnet interface to SV2AGW's PE Engine\r\n");
124  |   tn_printf("Enter ? for help\r\n");
125  |   tn_printf("> ");
126  |   agwpe_status |= CMD_MODE;			/*--- Go in command mode  */
127  |   return(agwpe_status);
128  | }
129  | 
130  | /*++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
131  | Description: Get data from the telnet client socket and store it
132  | in the ring buffer. The socket number used is a global variable.
133  | +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
134  | int
135  | get_telnet_data (RINGBUF *ringbuf, int tn_sock)		/*+ Pointer to ringbuf +*/
136  | /*+ Returns number of bytes received (>=0) or -1 if socket is closed +*/
137  | {
138  |   #define BUFSIZE 256 	/*+ This is a static size for now +*/
139  |   BYTE buf[BUFSIZE];    
140  |   int t = 0;         
141  |   int i;
142  |   size_t size = (size_t)(BUFSIZE-1);
143  | 
144  |   /*@+matchanyintegral@*/  /*--- Avoid LCLINT warning  */
145  |   /* Do receive as non-blocking */
146  |   fcntl(telnet_sock, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
147  |   t = recv ( tn_sock, buf, (size_t) size, 0 );
148  |   if (t == -1 && errno == EWOULDBLOCK)
149  |     return(0);	  /*--- No bytes received */
150  |   if (t == 0)
151  |     return(-1);	  /*--- Disconnected  */
152  | 
153  |   buf[t] = '\0';
154  | 
155  | 
156  |   /*--- Store incoming data in own ring buffer  ---*/
157  |   for (i=0 ; i<t ; i++) {
158  |     ringbuf_put(ringbuf,buf[i]);
159  |   }
160  | 
161  |   /*--- Echo incoming data to standard output  */
162  |   for (i=0 ; i<t ; i++) {
163  |     /*--- Check for the special character to go back to command mode  */
164  | 	if (buf[i] == 0x03) {			/*--- CTRL-C will go back to cmd mode  */
165  | 	  agwpe_status |= CMD_MODE;		/*--- Set command mode flag */
166  | 	  return(t);					/*--- Return now  */
167  | 	}
168  |     printf("%c",buf[i]);			/*--- Echo to screen  */
169  | 	tn_printf("%c",buf[i]);			/*--- Echo back to telnet client  */
170  |   }
171  | 
172  |   return(t); 	/*--- Return number of bytes received  */
173  |   /*@=matchanyintegral@*/	/*--- Restore original LCLINT value */
174  | }
175  | 
176  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
177  | Send telnet data over the current connection. This assumes that
178  | only 1 connection exists at a time
179  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
180  | void send_telnet_data(BYTE *buf, int len)		/*+ Data to send +*/
181  | {
182  |   /*--- Check if really a telnet client is connected  */
183  |   if (!(agwpe_status & TN_CONNECTED)) 
184  |     return;
185  | 
186  |   /*--- Echo back to telnet client  */
187  |   if ( send ( telnet_sock, buf, len, 0 ) <= 0 ) {
188  |     perror ( "agw_telnet_send()" );
189  |     exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
190  |   }
191  | }
192  | 
193  | /*++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
194  | Description: Close socket used for the connection to AGWPE
195  | +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
196  | void 
197  | tn_close(int socket)		/*+ Socket to close +*/
198  | {
199  |   /*--- Check if really a telnet client is connected  */
200  |   if (!(agwpe_status & TN_CONNECTED)) 
201  |     return;
202  | 
203  |   /*--- Close the socket and exit this program  ---*/
204  |   fflush(stdout);
205  |   (void) close (socket);
206  |   fflush(stdout);
207  | }
208  | 
209  | 
210  | /**************************************************************************
211  | Following functions return information, so we do not use global variables.
212  | ***************************************************************************/
213  | 
214  | 
215  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
216  | Get the socket number of the current telnet connection
217  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
218  | int
219  | get_telnet_sock(void)
220  | /*+ Returns socket number +*/
221  | {
222  |   return(telnet_sock);
223  | }
224  | 
225  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
226  | Get the socket number of were we listen on
227  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
228  | int
229  | get_listen_sock(void)
230  | /*+ Returns socket number +*/
231  | {
232  |   return(listen_sock);
233  | }
234  | 
235  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
236  | Close all telnet sockets
237  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
238  | void
239  | tn_close_all(void)
240  | {
241  |   tn_close(get_telnet_sock());		/*--- Close incoming telnet socket  */
242  |   agwpe_status &= ~TN_CONNECTED;	/*--- Adjust status  */
243  |   tn_close(get_listen_sock());		/*--- Close socket we listen on  */
244  |   agwpe_status &= ~TN_LISTENING;	/*--- Adjust status  */
245  | 
246  | }
247  | 
248  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
249  | A printf function for the telnet connection
250  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
251  | void
252  | tn_printf(char *format, ...)
253  | {
254  |   va_list arg;
255  |   char s[180];
256  |   int len;
257  | 
258  |   va_start(arg, format);
259  | 
260  |   /*--- Send to telnet socket  */
261  |   if (agwpe_status & TN_CONNECTED) {
262  |     vsprintf(s, format, arg);
263  | 	len = strlen(s);
264  |     send_telnet_data(s,len);
265  |   }
266  | 
267  |   va_end(arg);
268  | }
269  | 
270  | #endif
271  |
